ACT
235
A will subsequently found
If a will is found after the decision on inheritance becomes final, the court will declare it, and submit the record of the declaration and a copy of the will to the probate court, and keep its original.
In the case referred to in paragraph 1 of this article, the probate court will not conduct the probate hearing again, but will inform the interested persons about the promulgation of the will and warn them that they can exercise their rights based on the will in litigation.
